Case reference: 2014004253.CaseDesc: On October 13, 2000, two boats were on the Churchill River headed to Granville Lake. One of the boats began taking on water and experiencing motor problems. Most of the occupants of the disabled boat boarded another boat. Mr. Linklater however stayed on the disabled boat attempting to start it. The missing boat was located the next day, however Mr. Linklater was not aboard. He is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2020011471.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1975, at approximately 9:00 am, Stella Zayats was last seen by her husband as she left her residence to go for a walk in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004736.CaseDesc: Mary-Anne Loranger, her husband and their baby were camping on Beckwith Island in Georgian Bay for an unknown amount of time, prior to July 31, 1970. In the morning of August 2, 1970, Mary-Anne Loranger left Beckwith Island with a male friend, Robert Lehto in a canoe. Their intended destination was Cedar Point, Tiny Township, Ontario. A storm occurred later that day and did not subside until August 4, 1970. It is believed the canoe they were in capsized at some point while they were on their way to Cedar Point.

Case reference: 2013000039.CaseDesc:
Darryl Ferneyhough went missing on the morning of Sunday, May 13, 2001. Darryl was seen at the
night club NRG on Gottingen Street at 1:30 a.m. and later seen at 3:40 a.m. running north on Gottingen Street in the area of the Marquee Club.

Case reference: 2016065655.CaseDesc:
On May 27, 1978, a female was found floating 1000 feet off the west shore of Fighting Island, Sandwich West Township in the Detroit River. 
Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being 155lbs, however, this measurement may not represent her actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. 
It is estimated that she had been in the water for a couple of days to a couple of weeks.

Teeth: Several amalgam restorations and is missing her upper left canine tooth

Blouse: Multi-coloured long-sleeved button front, floral & green square pattern "Lennington California"Brand
Socks: Cotton, Multi-coloured red and yellow elasticized cotton ankle socks

Other: Intrauterine device implanted in her uterus.

Case reference: 2014003706.CaseDesc: Albert Crow and a friend attempted to cross Harrop Lake, Manitoba in a canoe despite high winds and the rough water. A second party in another canoe was ahead of Mr. Crow's and observed at one point of the crossing that the canoe was no longer visible. Searches were made of the shoreline and dragging operations of the lake were undertaken at the time without success. On October 12, 1974, the body of Mr. Crow's friend was recovered. His cause of death was later determined to be drowning. Albert Crow is presumed also dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2013000029.CaseDesc: On November 4, 1991, Montreal Police received a complaint from Mr. Katnick reporting that his daughter Leslie Anne Katnick was missing. Leslie Katnick had been residing in Montreal, Quebec until November 1, 1991, which was the last time she was seen by either friends or family. The investigation revealed that a Leslie Katnick registered into the Halifax YMCA on November 2, 1991, for several nights and returned the key on November 4, 1991. No further information has surfaced with respect to the whereabouts of Leslie Katnick. The circumstances of her disappearance are suspicious and foul play may be involved.

Case reference: 2014004294.CaseDesc: On May 28, 2001, Jean-Paul Leroux was seen for the last time when he left his spouse’s residence in Montreal, Quebec.  His vehicle was located abandoned 7 days later in the parking lot of the Saint-Leonard shopping centre. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001314.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1981, Verna Bjerky was seen for the last time hitchhiking from Hope to Kamloops, British Columbia. She was carrying roller skates over her shoulder and was seen getting into a vehicle with a lone occupant. Verna has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Long blonde hair with short bangs

Shoes: Canvas, Brown, "North Star" Brand, running shoes
Shirt: Red, White, Red with white flowers

Case reference: 2014004752.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2005 a man attended the Victoria Police Department and reported not seeing Belinda Cameron for over one month.  He told police Belinda had mentioned wanting to visit relatives in Vancouver and Manitoba but did not provide names to police.  This man reported sharing an intimate relationship with Belinda outside of his own marriage.  He said she was not a habitual runaway.  This man denied harming Belinda and through a Polygraph examination was determined to be honest.  The Victoria Police investigated Belinda's disappearance and determined that Belinda suffered from a mental illness, had a drug addiction and may have been a sex trade worker.  The last confirmed sighting of Belinda was at Shoppers Drug Mart at 870 Esquimalt Rd.  She failed to attend thereafter to pick up her daily medication.

Hair: Black, Long, Separated in the middle

Case reference: 2007002999.CaseDesc: Luciano Trinaistich was last seen at his residence on the 24th of July 2007 where he left and indicated that he was going to pick blueberries along Murphy Road near Timmins, Ontario. When he did not return home his wife contacted the Timmins Police Service and reported him missing. A search was conducted by the Timmins Police Service and the Ontario Provincial Police which resulted in locating the missing male's vehicle parked down a sideroad that runs off of Murphy Road. An extensive ground search has been conducted in the vicinity of the recovered vehicle with negative results.

Case reference: 2014005643.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2008, it was reported a boat had capsized in Lake Winnipeg, 15 miles south east of Poplar River between Marchand Point and George Island. The boat left Poplar Point on Oct 20, 2008, to remove buoys from Lake Winnipeg. During the evening, the boat experienced technical difficulties and was unable to continue. Throughout the early morning hours the weather began to worsen, experiencing 10 foot waves, at this time the vessel started to take in water. As a result the boat began to sink. Two of the three passengers were able to make it to Marchand's Point where they were rescued. No foul play is suspected and it is presumed George Donald Everett drowned.

Jacket: Nylon, Black, zippered Bomber style with "Berens River" patch on back

Case reference: 2008015599.CaseDesc: In late February 2006 William "Billy" Mason of Hamilton Ontario went missing. An extensive investigation has been conducted by the Hamilton Police Service but William Mason has not been seen or heard from since.  It is known that Billy Mason was murdered shortly after he went missing. The responsible person was convicted of his killing but Billy Mason's remains have not been recovered.

Case reference: 2012020112.CaseDesc: On February 14 2007, Philippe Lajoie was seen for the last time in Saint-Didace in the Lanaudière region, Quebec. He left his parents’ home at approximately 6 p.m. to go to a pig farm located on Petite-Rivière Nord road, in Yamachiche in the Mauricie region of Quebec. His vehicle was found there the next day.

Case reference: 2014005187.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of December 29, 1960, Helga Kaserer was seen for the last time in the area of Harvard Avenue and Roncesvalles Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003631.CaseDesc: Xiu Zi Lin was last seen on February 3, 1998 in Montreal. Ms. Lin came from China with no documentation or family. She was placed in a shelter. She left the center without giving a new address.

Case reference: 2013000022.CaseDesc: Mr. Shenchiu "Andy" Tsou was last seen at the Halifax Casino on June 26, 2005. He was known as a regular client at the Casino. Mr. Tsou was travelling from Richmond BC.

Case reference: 2006017999.CaseDesc: Agnes Battersby was visiting a friend in Barrie, Ontario; who then drove her home around 1:30 a.m. on July 28, 1968. She was unable to walk very far due to her disability. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014003046.CaseDesc: Yu Lowe was last seen on February 15, 1984 when he left his home in Vancouver, British Columbia. Mr. Lowe said he was going to the movies and never came back.

Case reference: 2004005470.CaseDesc: Tamra Jewel Keepness disappeared from her home on Ottawa Street in Regina, Saskatchewan when she was just 5 years old. She went missing from her bedroom sometime overnight.

Pants: Denim, Blue, Pockets on the front

Case reference: 2014005265.CaseDesc: At approximately 4:00 p.m. on Saturday June 13, 2009, Devon Brock Moldowan left his apartment in Jasper and did not return. He has not been in contact with family or friends since. Mr. Moldowan does not have a vehicle or bike and is believed to have left on foot.

Pants: Black, Patches with yellow and orange stitching

Tattoo: Chest, The words "I'll keep you here for all my"

Case reference: 2012020041.CaseDesc: Carolyn Pruyser was last seen at a Mohawk service station in Peace River shortly after midnight on May 17, 1984.  Her car was found abandoned a short distance from her parents home with keys and purse still in the car.

Blouse: Yellow, Orange, Short Sleeve "V" Neck Blouse

Case reference: 2016050007.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2016, the day of his birthday, Martin Ste-Croix was seen for the last time as he left his family residence. He told his family that he wanted to go to western Canada, specifically to Kelowna, British Columbia, to look for work. Martin left without his passport, little money and clothing.

Case reference: 2006012399.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2003, an unidentified man was discovered in the Ottawa River, near the Ottawa Rowing Club, in Ottawa, Ontario.

Shirt: Blue, Black, Long sleeve, Plaid; flannel; size extra large

Case reference: 2014004917.CaseDesc: Robert Rudish and Lee Vrba arrived in Island Lake Manitoba on June 11, 1972, to fish. On June 17, RCMP received a report that a canoe was found overturned in the water. The canoe was soon identified as belonging to Mr. Vrba. RCMP Investigators surmised the men went missing on either the Thursday or the Friday. The weather on both days was extreme, with high winds gusting to 30 mph, which caused the lake to be quite rough. Neither of the two men have been located and it is presumed both drowned.

Tattoo: tattoo on right or left forearm

Case reference: 2014004721.CaseDesc: Belinda Gertrude Williams was last seen by her sister and father in July 1976 in Vancouver. Ms. Williams was not reported missing until February 2004 to the Stl'Atl'lmx Tribal Police in Mt. Currie, BC.  Stl'Atl'lmx Tribal Police determined that Ms. Williams was last seen in Mission, BC.

Scar: Eyes, Below eye, unknown which eye

Case reference: 2014004547.CaseDesc: Ervin Moar is transient in nature and is known to frequent the Main Street strip of Winnipeg, MB. Mr. Moar has not been seen or heard from since June 3, 2004.

Case reference: 2013000078.CaseDesc: Candelerio Rodriguez has been missing from Montreal since August 18, 2003 . Mr. Rodriguez might be in the United States.

Case reference: 2014003023.CaseDesc: Joseph Roussel was last seen climbing Mount Edith Cavell in Jasper National Park.

Case reference: 2014002748.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1981, Jerry Torarak was last seen at 11:15 p.m. He had been travelling back to Hopedale, NL from Railroads, NL via boat with family. Approximately 15 miles off shore from Hopedale, Jerry fell over board into the water and sank out of sight.

Case reference: 2014004496.CaseDesc: Peter Cortner was last seen on May 20, 2004. He was reported missing by his apartment manager where he resided in Downtown Vancouver. He had left all his belongings behind in his apartment suite and dissapeared without notice.

Case reference: 2014027689.CaseDesc: Sindy Ruperthouse's family has had no news of her since April 2014 and on September 2, 2014, they reported her missing to the Sûreté du Québec of Amos. Mrs. Ruperthouse was last seen in Val d'Or on April 22, 2014 during a consultation at the Local Community Service Centre (CLSC).

Case reference: 2014005179.CaseDesc: On September 20, 2006, Richard Griffis was seen for the last time when he went down to the White River in the remote community of Beaver Creek in the Yukon. Richard had been visiting from the United States, and had travelled to the Yukon to test out an outdoor survival suit that he invented.

Case reference: 2019072428.CaseDesc: In April of 2019, Corey Baldwin was seen for the last time in Ottawa, Ontario. It is out of character for Corey not to contact his father for an extended period of time. It is possible that Corey may be in British Columbia or Montreal, Quebec.

Tattoo: Middle Back, Dragon on entire back
Left Arm, Sleeve with a graffiti wreath
Right Arm, Cartoon wolf with a police hat
Right Arm, A full sleeve to the elbow
Left Upper Arm, Inside left bicep written "I love her"
Scar: Chest, 2-3 Inches, a horizontal deep scar on the sternum
Lower Back, Surgical scar, horseshoe shape on the tailbone

Case reference: 2014004591.CaseDesc: Philip Leishman left his family home in Kakisa Lake, Northwest Territories, with a friend in July of 2004. He advised his family that he was traveling to Fort McMurray, Alberta. It has been confirmed that Mr. Leishman was in Fort McMurray until late August of 2004. He has not been heard from since. He also has ties to Port Alberni, B.C., Grand Prairie and Calgary, AB.

Case reference: 2014001430.CaseDesc: On July 28, 1980, Robert Wiggins was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2012020072.CaseDesc: Claudette Osborne (nee Tyo) was last seen on the morning of July 25, 2008  walking away from the Lincoln Motor Inn on McPhillips Street.

Hair: Brown, Blonde, Straight, Long, bottom 12" dyed blonde

Case reference: 2012020157.CaseDesc: The partial skeletal remains of this adult male were recovered on a ranch property on Lindley Creek Road in close proximity to the Shulus Indian Reserve in Merritt BC.

Case reference: 2014001664.CaseDesc: On September 12, 1982, Harold Larcher and his girlfriend set out in separate canoes with their supplies. Both canoes displayed their own leaks. After the river, they saw waves on the lake. The canoes began filling with water from these same waves.  Harold's girlfriends’ canoe sunk but she could see he was still in his canoe as she was struggling to right her own. She was unable to do so, but at one point was able to sit on top of it. Eventually she made her way to shore, however she did not see Harold again.  Numerous personal items belonging to Harold were recovered including his Passport and a life jacket that could have been his.  It is presumed Mr.Larcher drowned.

Case reference: 2014004758.CaseDesc: Brent Bassett was last seen in December 1987 and was living on his boat that had no engine at West Bay Marina in Esquimalt, British Columbia. Mr. Bassett struggled with cognitive issues and was known to be friendly and trusting. Mr. Bassett  collected bottles from other people in the Marina for spending money and worked at the Salvation Army Thrift Store.

Case reference: 2014005229.CaseDesc: On March 25, 2009 at around 11:00 am, Ronald Hallam was seen for the last time on his property on Prosperity Line road in the municipality of Ashfield-Colborne-Wawanosh, Ontario.

Pants: Brown, Khaki, Light brown work pants

Case reference: 2018034298.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2018, Trevor Hamlyn was last seen at around 3:00 pm at his home in Paradise, Newfoundland and Labrador.  It is unknown what Trevor was wearing at the time.  Information received was that Trevor spent time in the woods with unknown individuals.

Case reference: 2014003990.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1978, Yashar Ilkay and his wife went to bed for the night. When Yashar’s wife woke up in the morning, her husband was no longer in the residence. He left his residence without his glasses, dentures and money. Mr. Ilkay was last seen in Moncton downtown area.

Shirt: brown, white and blue long sleeve shirt

Case reference: 2014005577.CaseDesc: Ganiyu Adedeji Onabule was reported missing in Edmonton in June of 1975. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005999.CaseDesc: On February 5, 2013, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Quincy Blackburn was seen for the last time when his sister dropped him off at the Toronto Person International Airport in Toronto, Ontario. Quincy boarded a flight to Trinidad and was scheduled to return on February 19, but did not board the flight.

Pants: Red, White, TRACK, Track pants; Brand: Adidas
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Earrings, Square diamond earrings

Case reference: 2014005385.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Laura Lee Murray. She was last seen in downtown Calgary, Alberta, on June 25, 1992.

Case reference: 2013000004.CaseDesc: John Wade left his parents’ home in Halifax, NS on June 17, 2012. He left on foot while distraught, leaving behind his identification, bank card and money. He has been known to reside on the streets and does have connections to Edmonton, AB. Mr. Wade has previously hitchhiked across Canada. He suffers with mental illness and is diagnosed with schizophrenia.

Teeth: Good, Upper front tooth is capped

Case reference: 2014001067.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1993, the body of an unidentified elderly woman was found in the Fraser River, upstream from the city of New Westminster, British-Columbia. She wore a single octagonal silver ring on her left hand and had full dentures.

Ring: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Third finger on left hand, octagonal shape

Case reference: 2020049381.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2020 Sean Hart was last seen leaving Seven Oaks Receiving Home in Victoria, British Columbia.  Sean has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003214.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1982, Clyde "Van" Ditmars was reported missing to the Thunder Bay Police Service by his family. Van sought work in British Columbia, Alberta and Manitoba in the early 1980s as a welder. Since being reported missing, Van's family has not heard from him and his whereabouts are unknown.

Scar: Abdomen, Surgical; from the center of chest to the belt line and then to the left
Abdomen, Surgical, horizontal on the left side
Neck, 1 1-2" raised scar on front of the neck

Case reference: 2014004558.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1992, at approximately 9:00am, Rodolfo Morales was last heard from when he spoke to his friend over the telephone.

Case reference: 2020007628.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1971, at approximately 8:30pm, Stephanie Rawlinson was last seen near 2801 Jane Street in Toronto, Ontario. Stephanie had left her home in a cab after getting into a disagreement.

Mark: Right Eye, Mole near right eye

Case reference: 2014001173.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1979, this unidentified individual was involved in a fatal motor vehicle collision near Wildwood, Alberta, and the remains were burned beyond recognition. The individual is believed to be a hitchhiker from Quebec, possibly named John. There are no dental restorations present and a few teeth had been extracted.

Jacket: Nylon, Black, Ski Jacket, Ski jacket with red and white stripes on the sleeve

Case reference: 2014001506.CaseDesc: During the early morning hours of February 24, 1991, Harrison Brown left a friend's home on snowmobile and was last seen traveling near open water.

Hat: Plastic, Black, Snowmobile helmet with red and gold stripes

Scar: Left Upper Arm, Just above elbow

Case reference: 2014003916.CaseDesc: Pierrette Bouffard was last seen on January 9, 1997, in Saint-Romuald, Quebec, as she was heading to her room in the home she was living in.

Case reference: 2019000913.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2019, Daniel Hill was seen for the last time in Medicine Hat, Alberta.

Case reference: 2018008636.CaseDesc: On February 6, 2018, at approximately 11:30pm, Guerman Pouchkine was last seen in the area of Steels Avenue West and Keele Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2019010720.CaseDesc: Patrick Comeau was last seen on November 13, 2017, in Montreal, Quebec. Patrick has been known to frequent the downtown Montreal area.

Case reference: 2012020025.CaseDesc: At about 8:15 pm on May 3, 1983, 16 year old Shelley-Anne Bacsu left a friend’s house in the Sunset Trailer Park to walk the 7 km to her home. Her route took her west on Highway 16 through Hinton, then north on Highway 40. Witnesses saw Shelley-Anne walking westbound along the shoulder of Highway 16 carrying her school books; she was not hitch-hiking. Shelley-Anne was last seen in the area of what was then the western edge of town. A dark colored van was seen in the area around the time Shelley-Anne was walking home, some reports were that it was stopped at the side of the road near where she was last seen. An extensive search for the van and/or its occupants was not successful. Several days after Shelley-Anne was last seen, some of her belongings were found near the Athabasca River not far from the outskirts of Hinton.

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom

Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2013000054.CaseDesc: On December 28, 2006, Carlisle Callum-Drummond was seen for the last time in the Cotes-des-Neiges -Notre-Dame-de-Grace district of Montreal, Quebec. Carlisle left from his home and it is possible that he may be with his father, who is also missing.

Case reference: 2014005358.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2007, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Ana Jimenez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Ana’s daughter found that her mother and all of her personal belongings were gone. Ana had been visiting from Columbia and was due to return on September 27, but never boarded her flight.

Case reference: 2003006900.CaseDesc: Krzysztof Syrzycki was last seen in Coquitlam, British Columbia on June 29, 2002.

Case reference: 2005006699.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2003, an unidentified man believed to be between 50 and 60 years old, was found in the woods off of Humberwood Boulevard, near Highway 427 and Rexdale Blvd., in Toronto. He was found beneath an overturned picnic table that he may have been using for shelter. His post-mortem length was reported to be between 5’0"-5’1" and his weight was 122lbs. Found within the vicinity of his body was a right black leather-type boot, a black sock, a white baseball hat, a green winter jacket, a navy-coloured winter jacket, a black long-sleeved shirt, a black belt and an empty bottle of Listerine mouthwash. It is believed that death occurred within 1-2 days of his discovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, He has multiple teeth missing with only one tooth remaining in his lower jaw

Other: Lighter and bus ticket in pocket
Boots: Leather, Black, Left boot only, size 9

Case reference: 2014006338.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1988, George Burke was last seen by his wife, when he left their residence in Edmonton, Alberta, to take the bus to work. That day, George did not arrive at work, and it is unknown whether he caught the bus.

Case reference: 2012020092.CaseDesc: Edward Keith Geddes was last seen sometime mid April, 2011, in the community of Neilburg, Saskatchewan. Mr. Geddes has been known to travel between Manitoba and British Columbia, and has been employed in the auto repair industry. Mr. Geddes does not have a vehicle associated to him as he was known to buy and sell vehicles on a regular basis.

Case reference: 2014006290.CaseDesc: Roxanne Marie Isadore was reported missing by a family member on September 24, 2013.  She had been out of family contact since she moved to Edmonton from Valleyview in 2006. Her last confirmed whereabouts were in Edmonton, in June of 2008.  She was known to live in the area of, and to frequent, 118 Ave in the Beverly neighbourhood of Edmonton, AB.

Case reference: 2014005000.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2004, Mr. Lathlin was reported missing to police by his wife. She indicated to police the last time she saw Mr. Lathlin was on June 14th at which time he was leaving for Winnipeg from The Pas for a medical appointment on the 15th. He did not take any clothing and only took personal grooming items. Mr. Lathlin later called advising his wife he would be staying in Winnipeg as he had another appointment on Thursday. He again called his wife on Saturday morning asking for money. His wife sent the money as requested, however by Tuesday it was not claimed and it was returned to her. Mr. Lathlin has a history of living on the streets and has ties to Edmonton where he spent years on the street there. He also has various medical concerns. It is believed that Mr. Lathlin is likely in Winnipeg of his own volition. Mr. Lathlin's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2018008230.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1993, Trevor Chase was seen for the last time by his relatives in Truro, Nova Scotia. Trevor’s family believed that he may have been residing in Vancouver, British Columbia, in 1994.

Case reference: 2018013207.CaseDesc: On the morning of March 12, 2018, Ariel Kouakou left his home, on foot, to go to a friend’s house. At around 11:15 am, a witness walking a dog saw Ariel on the bicycle path in Park of la Merci located between Gouin Boulevard and the Rivière des Prairies.

Case reference: 2014001530.CaseDesc: Ronald Nodeland was last seen by his family on August 20, 1978 at his residence in Edson. Mr. Nodeland’s motorcycle and helmet were recovered approximately one month later in a remote area south west of Sundre, Alberta. Mr. Nodeland may have been seen on foot in the area a short time later however he was never located.

Case reference: 2014002549.CaseDesc: Wladyslaw Klisko was last seen on September 11, 1983, in Montreal. He left his house in the morning to go to church. He took the bus but was not seen at the church.

Case reference: 2014008479.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2014 William Grange was on vacation at the Cambridge Beach Resort and Spa in Bermuda. In the evening, he walked away from the resort.

Jewelry: Gold, wedding band with one diamond

Scar: Unknown, Small white scar, approx. 3" long, on top of hand, unknown right or left hand
Left Side Of Head, Surgical scar on left side of head/scalp from brain surgery

Case reference: 2014005024.CaseDesc: On November 16, 2007, Pierre Landry was seen for the last time in the area of Saint-Joseph-de-Beauce, Quebec. Pierre would have left his residence on foot and there are no indications in the direction he would have taken.

Case reference: 2014006219.CaseDesc: On the night of the 17 to 18 August 2013, Benoit Germain was seen for the last time while he was attending a truck show in Baie-du-Febvre, Qebec. His car was found abandoned a few days later on a trail to a wooded area north of La Tuque, Quebec. Benoit has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004058.CaseDesc: On January 11, 2001, Yvan Martellino was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Yvan was baptized in the name of Joseph Pierre Raymond Lussier. He studied communication and accounting. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2005002299.CaseDesc: On August 11, 1983, this male was recovered from Lake Erie off the shore of Holiday Beach, Malden Township. His weight at autopsy was estimated to be between 170-180 lbs., however, due to the incompleteness of the remains, the weight range suggested is an underestimate. This individual died as a result of foul play. It is believed that he had been in the water for approximately 6 months prior to recovery.

Hair: Brown, Red, Dyed, dyed reddish hairs interspersed with dark brown hairs and some greying hairs

Jeans: Denim, Blue, remnants of blue denim including a button with the inscription "Corniche Jeans"; size 31
Underwear: Light Blue, remnants of a blue elastic waistband which may be boxer shorts or swimming trunks

Case reference: 2014004675.CaseDesc: Jean-Louis Bourgeault was last seen on September 12, 2005 in Montreal. Mr. Bourgeault left the Suzanne Blanchard Pavillon, a mental health resource linked to the Louis Hippolyte Lafontaine Hospital. Mr. Bourgeault was homeless in downtown Montreal prior to entering the Pavillon.

Case reference: 2017008453.CaseDesc: On September 7, 2015, Lorne Parkes was last seen in Kelowna, British Columbia.

Case reference: 1994001800.CaseDesc: On the evening of August 5, 1989, Casey Bohun was seen for the last time by her mother when she was put to bed in her home in Delta, British Columbia. Prior to her disappearance, Casey and her family had recently moved to this area, and she was not familiar with the neighbourhood. Today, Casey may not realize that she was abducted as a child.

Case reference: 2014004910.CaseDesc: In 2002, Suppiah Dillirajah was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Suppiah had not been seen for five years.

Case reference: 2014004086.CaseDesc: On July 13,1981, Sophia Armstrong was seen for the last time. Her companion reported that she had gone on a trip, which was out of character for Ms. Armstrong.

Case reference: 2014001095.CaseDesc: On the evening of April 11, 1998, the body of an adult female believed to be between the ages of 30-40, with long dark hair and blue eyes was found deceased at the Broadway SkyTrain Station in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was very lean and pale and was wearing a long red wool coat over jeans and black ankle boots.

Coat: Wool, Red, Long coat with hood

Case reference: 1992003440.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1984, Daniel Worobec, 18 years old, was last seen in Lanigan, SK. A witness stated that Mr. Worobec told him he was waiting for a ride. Searches and investigation have failed to locate Mr. Worobec

Boots: Brown, cowboy boots with square toes
Hat: Blue, White, ball cap with writing on it

Case reference: 2020004223.CaseDesc: On December 24, 2019, Ryan Docherty was seen for the last time by his family in London, Ontario. The last known contact between Ryan and his friends was during the last week of December. On March 6, 2020, his mother reported him missing after returning from an extended trip, and noticing that Ryan had not shown up at her residence to retrieve some cheques.

Tattoo: Upper Back, Words: "EAZY-E"; gun and bullet
Left Hand, A heart with the name "Jodi"
Left Wrist, 6 eyes inside a triangle
Chest, Doc and Pennywise the clown
Scar: Right Hand, 3 inches on the top

Case reference: 2014002175.CaseDesc: Dale Dushinski is a prospector from Edmonton, Alberta. Mr. Dushinski was canoeing on the Athabasca River. He was reported missing by his parents on November 6, 1983. Mr. Dushinski's canoe was found overturned on the Athabasca River approximately 10 km north of Fort McMuray on October 29, 1983.

Scar: A scar from a biopsy, unsure which knee

Case reference: 2014006038.CaseDesc: Kimberley Cruickshank was reported missing on March 25, 2013. She was last seen on March 22, 2013 in her apartment on the 2400 Block of Abbott Road in Regina, SK.

Hair: Brown, Red, Straight, Hair is shaved around sides and back with medium length section on the top

Pierce: Ears, 3 piercings on the right side and 1 on the left

Case reference: 2014005532.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1984, Emily Koble had been picked up by two ladies that felt Mrs. Koble had appeared lost and confused. Mrs. Koble was dropped off near Christopher Lake, SK when she asked to get out of the vehicle. The ladies called the Royal Canadian Mounted Police, however, a search failed to locate Mrs. Koble.

Deformity: Shoulders, steel pin, unknown which shoulder

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016068950.CaseDesc: On March 2, 1978, a Caucasian male jumped off the Municipal Parking Garage, 65 Pitt Street East, Windsor. Prior to jumping he had told an observer that his name was Lester, that he was depressed and had been in the hospital.

Case reference: 2014003678.CaseDesc: On June 21, 1960, Donald McKillop's wife reported him missing to the Police. The last time she spoke to her husband was on June 19. She was working away from the home and returned on the June 20 to find her husband away.   Mr. McKillop's wife indicated to police she had spoken to her husband and he had not indicated he was leaving for any reason. Donald McKillop left the home without his wallet, there was no clothing missing and all his carpentry tools were present. Inquiries with family and friends revealed nothing else. Mr. McKillop had no history of mental disorder or suicidal tendencies.  There is no indication of foul play in his disappearance.

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.

Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2014001875.CaseDesc: On May 25th, 1987 at approximately 9:00 a.m., Rene Parr left his home in Trois-Rivieres, Quebec, where he was living with his sister for the previous 6 months. He was in the process of a divorce and he was scheduled to attend the courthouse the next day. Rene has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020070.CaseDesc: Leslie Thomas was reported missing December 8, 2000.  He was last seen walking west on Hwy #201 of the Roseau River First Nation in the first week of November.  Mr. Thomas' whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2013000031.CaseDesc: On October 31, 2007, Edward D’Souza went missing from his home in Oakville, Ontario. Investigators believe that Mr. D’Souza travelled to Mumbai, India and may now be living in the Middle East under an assumed name.

Case reference: 2014004779.CaseDesc: On May 3, 2006, Mr. David Robillard left a cultural camp with the intention to walk back to his home community of Black Lake, SK. He was not seen again.

Deformity: Right Leg, walks with a limp

Case reference: 2014005576.CaseDesc: Daniel Dumigan's family lost contact with him in July of 1975. They received information that he was planning to leave for Vancouver, BC.

Case reference: 2014005110.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2008, at approximately 9:25 p.m., Jaquelyn Latto was seen for the last time as she left the Juliette Place Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Jaquelyn had told the staff at the shelter that she was going out with her brother.

Case reference: 2016068490.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1971, Mr. Georges Turcotte went missing from the Saint-Hyacinthe, Quebec area. Georges was last seen at his home with his wife.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Snake or zig zag
